alert.note: Alert for Mercer (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 28 at 7:11PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Mercer County through 745 PM EDT... At 711 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Matoaka, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Princeton... Matoaka... Camp Creek... Spanishburg... Kegley... Wenonah... and Montcalm. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
